lead_paragraph: Economists from both ends of the political spectrum say the president-elect’s approach of berating and rewarding companies may be good political theater but ultimately ineffective.

headline.print_headline: Vowing to Squeeze Businesses, Trump Has Tactics Challenged
headline.main: Vowing to Squeeze Businesses, Trump Has Tactics Challenged

snippet: Economists from both ends of the political spectrum say the president-elect’s approach of berating and rewarding companies may be good political theater but ultimately ineffective....
abstract: Donald Trump's tactics in discouraging American companies like Carrier and Rexnord from moving jobs overseas have drawn criticism from left and right, with critics saying his negotiations are ineffective and fall outside rule of law; Trump has proposed 35 percent tariff on goods brought back into United States after companies move production abroad, as well as overhaul of corporate taxes and elimination regulations; critics say Trump cannot unilaterally fight growing force of globalization.
